history.content:
I am also a transfer student who wanted a sixth semester to complete a double major. I requested a 6th semester through L&S last semester and met with one of the deans. It felt as if the decision about whether I deserved a sixth semester or not was made prior to me walking in the door, but also I may have read into that incorrectly. His response was pretty much give up on the second major, finish your major requirements and move on with life.

I have the feeling L&S is pretty set on only allowing us 5 semesters unless the sixth one is abroad. Once I got accepted to a study abroad opportunity, the 6th semester was immediately granted. Of course I agreed to not enroll in any classes on campus.

Perhaps, finding somewhere internationally to finish your requirements is an option.

Or delaying your graduation and enrolling in summer courses, next summer, to finish your requirements.

Hi, everyone, I'm a transfer student, double major CS and STAT. I know according to the policy of L&S, I have 5 semesters to finish my double major course requirement. But for now, my schedule looks very tight and fixed. If anything goes wrong with my schedule in the future(like course conflict), I may not be able to finish both majors in the worst scenario. So, I wonder is it possible to be granted an extra semester(6th)? I have decided to see L&S advisor discussing this issue. But I hope I could get some opinions from students who may have the same experiences or who know someone once successfully got the 6th semester. Thank you!
history.subject: Transfer student, 6th semester possible?
